posts.post_content: This guy is skill-testing. I like how if you don't know what you're doing, you will lose anyway. One of the few reanimation targets that is both worth it and also fair. Sort of.

Posted By: Goatllama (12/2/2011 3:07:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Sneak attack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sneak attack). Then play [Terastodon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terastodon), sacrifice stuff to get 3/3s. [Second Sunrise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Second Sunrise) to get sacrificed stuff and [Terastodon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terastodon) back. Sacrifice again, get 3 more 3/3s... Next turn swing for 26.
  
   
Works well to sacrifice [Ichor Wellspring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichor Wellspring)[Mycosynth Wellspring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Wellspring) this way. If you have 3 of these in play when you sneak attack the elefphant you will get 3 3/3 and draw 3 cards. After you second sunrise you get them back and draw another 3. Then Elephant makes you sac them again for another 3 3/3. 9 cards and 6 3/3s for 1WWR :)
posts.html:
Sneak attack. Then play Terastodon, sacrifice stuff to get 3/3s. Second Sunrise to get sacrificed stuff and Terastodon back. Sacrifice again, get 3 more 3/3s... Next turn swing for 26.

Works well to sacrifice Ichor WellspringMycosynth Wellspring this way. If you have 3 of these in play when you sneak attack the elefphant you will get 3 3/3 and draw 3 cards. After you second sunrise you get them back and draw another 3. Then Elephant makes you sac them again for another 3 3/3. 9 cards and 6 3/3s for 1WWR :)
